news.title: What Europe's response to a no-deal with Trump could look like
news.summary: Uncertainty remains about if and when a trade agreement between the EU and U.S. could be struck. Uncertainty remains over when and if an agreement will be struck between the two countries.

news.title: Volkswagen cuts guidance after taking $1.5 billion hit from U.S. tariffs in first half
news.summary: Europe's biggest carmaker posted a sharp drop in second-quarter profit. High costs from increased U.S. import tariffs were the main reason.

news.title: Trump spars with Powell over renovation costs during Fed visit, but backs off firing threats
news.summary: Trump has previously signaled he was considering whether to fire Powell. It is unclear if he has the legal authority to do so. The White House declined to comment on the report.

news.title: Intel beats on revenue, slashes foundry investments as CEO says 'no more blank checks'
news.summary: "Every investment must make economic sense," Tan wrote. "There are no more blank checks," he said. "Every investment ... must be economic sense"

news.title: FCC approves $8 billion Paramount-Skydance merger
news.summary: The Federal Communications Commission cleared the way Thursday for an $8 billion merger between Paramount and Skydance Media. The merger is expected to be completed by the end of the year.

news.title: Durable-goods orders show business investment holding up despite uncertainty
news.summary: The manufacturing side of the economy seems to be holding up despite heightened uncertainty about trade policies and high borrowing costs. The U.S. economy is expected to grow at a rate of around 2.5 percent this year.

news.title: ‘I have a degree in economics’: I’m 70, earn $250K a year and have $3.7 million in investments. Is it time to retire?
news.summary: "I have a home worth $1.3 million with $900,000 in equity," she says. "I have not paid it off as I have a 3% interest rate"

news.title: Why stock investors should be glad that House lawmakers are taking a long summer recess
news.summary: The Dow and the S&P 500 do much better when Congress is out of session. The Dow does better when the Senate is not in session.

news.title: Higher car prices help AutoNation beat sales and profit estimates, and its stock is rising
news.summary: Customers shrugged off higher prices and drove up sales. Customers shrugged off high prices, driving up sales in the U.S. and around the world.

news.title: Venus Williams says she returned to tennis for the health insurance — even after earning $42 million
news.summary: The tennis star’s comeback wasn’t about trophies. It was about health insurance, she said. “I’m not here for the trophies,” she told CNN. ‘I am here for my health.’
